sentences.english: And I shall never forget the delight of that moment.
sentences.chinese: 永志不忘那个时刻的愉快。

sentences.english: His courage and the sacrifice he has made will not be forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 他的无畏勇气和牺牲精神我们将永志不忘。

sentences.english: Indeed it was a memorable night.
sentences.chinese: 这的确是个永志不忘的夜晚。
这无私的奉献，令人永志不忘。

sentences.english: I will never forget my first love.
sentences.chinese: 你的慰问和关心将永志不忘。

definition: hard to forget even after one's teeth fall out (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
lit. will not be forgotten even after one's teeth fall out/to remember as long as one lives/unforgettable (idiom)

national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
to recall fondly/to remember with emotion
to recall/to bring to mind/to reminisce
Never forget national humiliation, refers to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
